results.title: Famous men and fair women
results.creator_credit: Ann Turner and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Pioneers of photography”.
Julia Margaret Cameron was an outstanding photographer of her day. Despite the restrictions of her social position, she became a recognised artist of portrait photography. Many notable individuals such as Charles Darwin and Alfred Lord Tennyson, were included amongst her subjects. The film gives insight into the social and cultural environment and the moral attitudes that affected concepts of beauty. Demonstrations of photographic procedures used during the 1800’s such as the sliding box camera, plates etc., is also shown. Narrated by Brian Coe.

constellations_other.name: Reality TV me
constellations_other.description: Cult documentary Grey Gardens follows the everyday eccentricities of mother and daughter Big Edie and Little Edie. The women perform and speak candidly to the camera, and have been described as predecessors to reality TV stars.

results.title: Family stress: the child's perspective
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN
results.brief_description:
Episode number 22 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Examines the social and economic forces that alter families and increase risks for children. Reviews research results on the effects of divorce on children, observing a Russian family on the brink of divorce. The determinants and outcomes of teen pregnancy are discussed with American teen mothers and mothers-to-be.

results.title: Family or friends...?
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Timothy Sullivan and Filmhouse
results.brief_description: Children from three age groups - five to nine, nine to twelve, and thirteen to eighteen - and different socio-economic classes are interviewed about their feelings on family relationships and the bonds of friendship. Useful for units of study on family relationships, social relationships and peer pressure.

results.title: Family of chimps
results.brief_description: A documentary recording the day-to-day activities of a chimpanzee family living in an open enclosure surrounded by a moat at Burgers Zoo in Arnheim. Scientists and the public observe their behaviour unobtrusively from a distance.

results.title: Family matters
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Facts for Life”.
Explains the transition from life in the womb to life after birth. Shows care of premature babies and stresses the importance of mother-child contact. Discusses mental milestones of the first 18 months and comments on the mother’s feelings of being on duty for 24 hours a day.

results.title: Family living: who cares?
results.brief_description: A discussion-provoking film which poses the problems created within a family when an elderly man moves into the home of his daughter, her husband and their two teenage children. Conflict develops between members of the family when their lifestyles clash with that of the grandfather, resulting in his asking the question, “Who cares?”.

results.title: Family follies
results.creator_credit: Peter J Ketchum and Guidance Associates
results.brief_description: Uses a humorous skit with dances, songs, and production numbers in order to highlight the problems which trouble young people: communication with parents, developing responsibility and independence from parents, and learning to cope with competitive attitudes in the family. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Family
results.creator_credit: Gene Feldman and Wombat Productions, Inc.
results.brief_description: Focusing on a typical nuclear family living in semi-rural Connecticut farmland, the role of the family in contemporary society is reviewed here. Members of this and other families give their views on marriage and family life, some upholding traditional views and others expressing discontent with the established system.
